channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024020919
item.description:
Report X-2024020919

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING ON TRUCK WHEN LOADED. REMOVED FROM TRUCK AND PLACED IN TOTE FOR QA. DescribePack: INSPECTION FOUND THE CAP HAD COME OFF A BOTTLE OF HAND SANITIZER, ALLOWING SPILLAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAP REPLACED. PACKAGE REMOVED FROM AREA OF OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report X-2024020575
item.description:
Report X-2024020575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020575 -RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE IRREG AREA. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE AND COLLECTED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. X-2024020576 -RESPONDER CALLED TO RESPOND TO A WET PKG. RESPONDER DONNED ALL PPE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP AND PROCESS THRU PROPER DMP PROCEDURES.

item.title: Report X-2024021022
item.description:
Report X-2024021022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS TILTED EITHER IN TRANSIT OR LOADED IMPROPER. IT WAS DISCOVERED BY UNLOADERS AS A WET PACKAGE AND PLACED IN A RED LINED BIN FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION THE LID WAS DISCOVERED LOOSE AND WHEN REMOVED SHOWED THE SAFETY SEAL WAS BROKEN . THERE WAS APPROX 4 FL OZ MISSING FROM THE BOTTLE THAT HAD LEAKED INTERNAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LID WAS TIGHTENED AND PACKAGE WAS PLACED UPRIGHT ACCORDING TO DIRECTIONAL ARROWS

item.title: Report X-2024021028
item.description:
Report X-2024021028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Oxidizer & Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Rapicide PA part A 5-liters was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid had a small manufactured hole on top that was allowing liquid content to leak out. DescribePack: Bottle was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid had a small manufactured hole on top that was allowing liquid content to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020942
item.description:
Report X-2024020942

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of StatLab Decal Stat leaked from loose caps. About 20 ounces were released. The bottles had a seal but the caps were not secured. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2024020701
item.description:
Report X-2024020701

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet in trailer placed in a plastic tote lined with hazmat bag and taken for inspection. DescribePack: Wet package containing 4 gallons of hydrochloric acid was found in a trailer being unloaded upon inspection gallon containers were in plastic bags and 2 were found to have loose caps and minimal spillage was found in the bag of the 2 one was crushed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once inspection was completed the 2 gallons that were found leaking were placed inside a hazmat bag and drum, the other 2 undamaged bottles were also placed in a hazmat bag and drum. Both were placed in hazmat cage.

item.title: Report I-2023110059
item.description:
Report I-2023110059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-24T00:32:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIJET HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Undeclared dangerous goods material. On 11-15-2023, AWB# 810-20766955 was transfered by highway to Amerijet MIA from ATL to KIN. The shipment contained 2 packages with a gross weight of 70 kg. Piece #1 contained 12 cans of UN2037, and piece #2 contained UN3528 in the form of a generator. The packages were discovered during routine CBP inspections and then reported. The Amerijet Dangerous Goods team inspected the shipment and confirmed the presence of undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment was placed on hold in the dangerous goods hold area.
